page.title: 02TEESIDE MERCURY
page.content: The{Teesdale Mercury}was first started in 1854.Mr.McTaggart who is the present editor has been editor for the Teesdale Mercury for twelve years .The biggest story for the Mercury lately has been the new supermarket that is opening in September next to the car park.The biggest stories ever for the Mercury were when a forty feet high bore came down the river and completly demolished the footbridge,killing two people and injuring four others.The stories for the Mercury are mainly anything that happens in this area.Most people see the shortage of work in the area as their biggest problem.The Mercury prints most letters that are sent in,especially if they are about local matters.The Mercury has a complete set of past issues from 1854.
